intro: Centaurea sarandinakiae, commonly known as the Sarandina thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny leaves and purple to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest in botanical studies. Centaurea sarandinakiae plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
